601.definition: [ἀποκαλύπτω] from {{G575}} and {{G2572}}; to take off the cover, i.e. disclose

603.definition: [ἀποκαραδοκία] from a comparative of {{G575}} and a compound of κάρα (the head) and {{G1380}} (in the sense of watching); intense anticipation

606.definition: [ἀπόκειμαι] from {{G575}} and {{G2749}}; to be reserved; figuratively, to await

609.definition: [ἀποκόπτω] from {{G575}} and {{G2875}}; to amputate; reflexively (by irony) to mutilate (the privy parts) Compare {{G2699}}.

610.definition: [ἀπόκριμα] from {{G611}} (in its original sense of judging); a judicial decision

611.definition: [ἀποκρίνομαι] from {{G575}} and κρίνω; to conclude for oneself, i.e. (by implication) to respond; by Hebraism (compare {{H6030}}) to begin to speak (where an address is expected)

613.definition: [ἀποκρύπτω] from {{G575}} and {{G2928}}; to conceal away (i.e. fully); figuratively, to keep secret

615.definition: [ἀποκτείνω] from {{G575}} and κτείνω (to slay); to kill outright; figuratively, to destroy

616.definition: [ἀποκυέω] from {{G575}} and the base of {{G2949}}; to breed forth, i.e. (by transference) to generate (figuratively)

618.definition: [ἀπολαμβάνω] from {{G575}} and {{G2983}}; to receive (specially, in full, or as a host); also to take aside

619.definition: [ἀπόλαυσις] from a comparative of {{G575}} and λαύω (to enjoy); full enjoyment

620.definition: [ἀπολείπω] from {{G575}} and {{G3007}}; to leave behind (passively, remain); by implication, to forsake

621.definition: [ἀπολείχω] from {{G575}} and λείχω (to "lick"); to lick clean

622.definition: [ἀπόλλυμι] from {{G575}} and the base of {{G3639}}; to destroy fully (reflexively, to perish, or lose), literally or figuratively

623.definition: [Ἀπολλύων] active participle of {{G622}}; a destroyer (i.e. Satan)

624.definition: [Ἀπολλωνία] from the pagan deity Ἀπόλλων (i.e. the sun; from {{G622}}); Apollonia, a place in Macedonia

625.definition: [Ἀπολλῶς] probably from the same as {{G624}}; Apollos, an Israelite

626.definition: [ἀπολογέομαι] middle voice from a compound of {{G575}} and {{G3056}}; to give an account (legal plea) of oneself, i.e. exculpate (self)

627.definition: [ἀπολογία] from the same as {{G626}}; a plea ("apology")

628.definition: [ἀπολούω] from {{G575}} and {{G3068}}; to wash fully, i.e. (figuratively) have remitted (reflexively)

629.definition: [ἀπολύτρωσις] from a compound of {{G575}} and {{G3083}}; (the act) ransom in full, i.e. (figuratively) riddance, or (specially) Christian salvation

630.definition: [ἀπολύω] from {{G575}} and {{G3089}}; to free fully, i.e. (literally) relieve, release, dismiss (reflexively, depart), or (figuratively) let die, pardon or (specially) divorce

631.definition: [ἀπομάσσομαι] middle voice from {{G575}} and μάσσω (to squeeze, knead, smear); to scrape away

632.definition: [ἀπονέμω] from {{G575}} and the base of {{G3551}}; to apportion, i.e. bestow

633.definition: [ἀπονίπτω] from {{G575}} and {{G3538}}; to wash off (reflexively, one's own hands symbolically)

635.definition: [ἀποπλανάω] from {{G575}} and {{G4105}}; to lead astray (figuratively); passively, to stray (from truth)

638.definition: [ἀποπνίγω] from {{G575}} and {{G4155}}; to stifle (by drowning or overgrowth)

639.definition: [ἀπορέω] from a compound of {{G1}} (as a negative particle) and the base of {{G4198}}; to have no way out, i.e. be at a loss (mentally)

640.definition: [ἀπορία] from the same as {{G639}}; a (state of) quandary

641.definition: [ἀποῤῥίπτω] from {{G575}} and {{G4496}}; to hurl off, i.e. precipitate (oneself)

642.definition: [ἀπορφανίζω] from {{G575}} and a derivative of {{G3737}}; to bereave wholly, i.e. (figuratively) separate (from intercourse)

643.definition: [ἀποσκευάζω] from {{G575}} and a derivative of {{G4632}}; to pack up (one's) baggage

644.definition: [ἀποσκίασμα] from a compound of {{G575}} and a derivative of {{G4639}}; a shading off, i.e. obscuration

645.definition: [ἀποσπάω] from {{G575}} and {{G4685}}; to drag forth, i.e. (literally) unsheathe (a sword), or relatively (with a degree of force implied) retire (personally or factiously)

646.definition: [ἀποστασία] feminine of the same as {{G647}}; defection from truth (properly, the state) ("apostasy")

647.definition: [ἀποστάσιον] neuter of a (presumed) adjective from a derivative of {{G868}}; properly, something separative, i.e. (specially) divorce

648.definition: [ἀποστεγάζω] from {{G575}} and a derivative of {{G4721}}; to unroof

649.definition: [ἀποστέλλω] from {{G575}} and {{G4724}}; set apart, i.e. (by implication) to send out (properly, on a mission) literally or figuratively

650.definition: [ἀποστερέω] from {{G575}} and στερέω (to deprive); to despoil

652.definition: [ἀπόστολος] from {{G649}}; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ ("apostle") (with miraculous powers)

653.definition: [ἀποστοματίζω] from {{G575}} and a (presumed) derivative of {{G4750}}; to speak off-hand (properly, dictate), i.e. to catechize (in an invidious manner)

654.definition: [ἀποστρέφω] from {{G575}} and {{G4762}}; to turn away or back (literally or figuratively)

655.definition: [ἀποστυγέω] from {{G575}} and the base of {{G4767}}; to detest utterly

657.definition: [ἀποτάσσομαι] middle voice from {{G575}} and {{G5021}}; literally, to say adieu (by departing or dismissing); figuratively, to renounce

658.definition: [ἀποτελέω] from {{G575}} and {{G5055}}; to complete entirely, i.e. consummate

659.definition: [ἀποτίθημι] from {{G575}} and {{G5087}}; to put away (literally or figuratively)

660.definition: [ἀποτινάσσω] from {{G575}} and τινάσσω (to jostle); to brush off

661.definition: [ἀποτίνω] from {{G575}} and {{G5099}}; to pay in full

663.definition: [ἀποτομία] from the base of {{G664}}; (figuratively) decisiveness, i.e. rigor

664.definition: [ἀποτόμως] adverb from a derivative of a comparative of {{G575}} and τέμνω (to cut); abruptly, i.e. peremptorily

665.definition: [ἀποτρέπω] from {{G575}} and the base of {{G5157}}; to deflect, i.e. (reflexively) avoid

666.definition: [ἀπουσία] from the participle of {{G548}}; a being away

667.definition: [ἀποφέρω] from {{G575}} and {{G5342}}; to bear off (literally or relatively)

669.definition: [ἀποφθέγγομαι] from {{G575}} and {{G5350}}; to enunciate plainly, i.e. declare

670.definition: [ἀποφορτίζομαι] from {{G575}} and the middle voice of {{G5412}}; to unload

671.definition: [ἀπόχρησις] from a compound of {{G575}} and {{G5530}}; the act of using up, i.e. consumption

673.definition: [ἀποχωρίζω] from {{G575}} and {{G5563}}; to rend apart; reflexively, to separate

674.definition: [ἀποψύχω] from {{G575}} and {{G5594}}; to breathe out, i.e. faint

675.definition: [Ἄππιος] of Latin origin; (in the genitive, i.e. possessive case) of Appius, the name of a Roman

676.definition: [ἀπρόσιτος] from {{G1}} (as a negative particle) and a derivative of a comparative of {{G4314}} and εἶμι (to go); inaccessible

677.definition: [ἀπρόσκοπος] from {{G1}} (as a negative particle) and a presumed derivative of {{G4350}}; actively, inoffensive, i.e. not leading into sin; passively, faultless, i.e. not led into sin

678.definition: [ἀπροσωπολήπτως] adverb from a compound of {{G1}} (as a negative particle) and a presumed derivative of a presumed compound of {{G4383}} and {{G2983}} (compare {{G4381}}); in a way not accepting the person, i.e. impartially

679.definition: [ἄπταιστος] from {{G1}} (as a negative particle) and a derivative of {{G4417}}; not stumbling, i.e. (figuratively) without sin

680.definition: [ἅπτομαι] reflexive of {{G681}}; properly, to attach oneself to, i.e. to touch (in many implied relations)

681.definition: [ἅπτω] a primary verb; properly, to fasten to, i.e. (specially) to set on fire

682.definition: [Ἀπφία] probably of foreign origin; Apphia, a woman of Collosæ

683.definition: [ἀπωθέομαι]   or ἀπώθομαιfrom {{G575}} and the middle voice of ὠθέω or ὤθω (to shove); to push off, figuratively, to reject

684.definition: [ἀπώλεια] from a presumed derivative of {{G622}}; ruin or loss (physical, spiritual or eternal)

685.definition: [ἀρά] probably from {{G142}}; properly, prayer (as lifted to Heaven), i.e. (by implication) imprecation

686.definition: [ἄρα] probably from {{G142}} (through the idea of drawing a conclusion); a particle denoting an inference more or less decisive (as follows) Often used in connection with other particles, especially {{G1065}} or {{G3767}} (after) or {{G1487}} (before). Compare also {{G687}}.

687.definition: [ἆρα] a form of {{G686}}, denoting an interrogation to which a negative answer is presumed

688.definition: [Ἀραβία] of Hebrew origin ({{H6152}}); Arabia, a region of Asia

689.definition: [Ἀράμ] of Hebrew origin ({{H7410}}); Aram (i.e. Ram), an Israelite

690.definition: [Ἄραψ] from {{G688}}; an Arab or native of Arabia

691.definition: [ἀργέω] from {{G692}}; to be idle, i.e. (figuratively) to delay

692.definition: [ἀργός] from {{G1}} (as a negative particle) and {{G2041}}; inactive, i.e. unemployed; (by implication) lazy, useless

694.definition: [ἀργύριον] neuter of a presumed derivative of {{G696}}; silvery, i.e. (by implication) cash; specially, a silverling (i.e. drachma or shekel)

695.definition: [ἀργυροκόπος] from {{G696}} and {{G2875}}; a beater (i.e. worker) of silver

696.definition: [ἄργυρος] from ἀργός (shining); silver (the metal, in the articles or coin)

697.definition: [Ἄρειος Πάγος] from Ἄρης (the name of the Greek deity of war) and a derivative of {{G4078}}; rock of Ares, a place in Athens

698.definition: [Ἀρεοπαγίτης] from {{G697}}; an Areopagite or member of the court held on Mars' Hill

700.definition: [ἀρέσκω] probably from {{G142}} (through the idea of exciting emotion); to be agreeable (or by implication, to seek to be so)
